title: What are your favorite Beatles songs featuring the 12-string guitar? - Quora

response.answer_text: They had so many songs that featured 12-string guitar that it’s almost like making a list of most of their mid-period stuff. But I’ll make that list. A Hard Day’s Night. Actually, I’m not too excited by the song, which I’ve heard too many times, but the intro and the fading ringing 12-string at the end elevate it to brilliance.“I Don’t Want to Spoil the Party.” One of Harrison’s greatest solos in this song.“What You’re Doing” is a nice Buddy HOlly pastiche with a great little 12-string guitar figure going through it.Speaking of Buddy Holly, the cover of “Words of Love” is feast for 12-string guitar lovers.And “Everybody Wants to Be My Baby” has two guitar solos. (I think that’s twelve string, sound like it to me.)Ticket To Ride. This 12-string guitar is just one piece of this incredible song.“If I Needed Someone” is lovely post-Byrds Beatles.“Rain”—great guitar, great bass, great drums, great vocals.
